title.narrative: Strengthening Free and Independent Media in South Sudan Program (i-STREAM)

description.narrative: (South Sudan): The Strengthening Free and Independent Media in South Sudan (i-STREAM) project supports access to comprehensive and unbiased media and increases the capacity of journalists and media outlets to operate effectively and safely. FY 2020 funds will be used to continue to provide citizens with access to critical information, including peace and conflict mitigation efforts, through support to the network of independent community radio stations (which broadcast in nine local languages) and increase the reach of Eye Radio. Eye Radio is currently available in six of South Sudan's 10 states through its repeater stations reaching upwards of three million citizens, broadcasting primarily in English and Juba Arabic, with limited reporting in local languages. Assistance to these stations will also be used to continue to develop the capacity of journalists and station operators. The project will also continue to provide sub-grant support to media organizations working to improve the media sector, provide critical advice and legal aid to journalists, and develop peace messaging and promote dialogue. The project will support media organizations' oversight of the implementation of the peace process as well as the response to the COVID-19 crisis, both in terms of radio programming and also efforts to minimize the effect of misinformation, and rumor tracking.. .. .
